Content: We oversee all things parking on campus, and all things transportation related to UTM. If you have questions regarding parking on campus or transportation support to and from campus, we can help! Please see below, email us , or give us a call at (905) 828-5254 with any questions. We look forward to helping you get to & from campus - Current Alerts *New* Daily Rate Increase Seasonal Reminders Last day to cancel annual student permits: March 6, 2026. More Information All 2025-2026 permits are currently waitlisted. Waitlist information What can we help you with? Parking on Campus Transportation to & from Campus Permits for On-Campus Parking Visitor Parking Map | Parking on Campus Barrier-Free Parking UTM Department Vehicles General Parking Information Parking availability is not guaranteed. Traffic and parking usage on campus is particularly heavy between 8:00am and 10:00am in the morning as folks arrive, and during class change between 11:00am and 3:00pm. Please budget enough time into your commute to park and reach your destination. Additional overflow parking is available in lots P11 and Alumni House . All UTM permits are valid in these locations. A reminder that parking on grass, sidewalks, etc is Not permitted. Any vehicles parked improperly on campus will be subject to enforcement. Paid Parking & Enforcement are in full effect at all times. Winter Sessional Permit Presale Winter Sessional permits for lots P4/P8 will be available for purchase starting 10:00 a.m. Wednesday December 3, 2025. Find more information on parking permits here . Daily Rate Price Increase Please note that daily rates will increase on September 1, 2025. The Daily Maximum will increase by $.50. DID YOU KNOW: if you park on campus more than once a week, you save money with a parking permit? Find more information on parking permits here . Find more information on non-permit parking, or visitor parking, here . parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Parking Payment Options on Campus The "AMP Park" app Now you have the choice to pay for parking using our easy-to-find and simple Pay & Display machines OR using the AMP Park app on your desktop or smartphone! Why do we love this app? Please note: You may not use the AMP app for parking past midnight, or overnight. Please use the Pay machines for parking past midnight and overnight parking. The AMP Park app A convenient way to pay for hourly or daily parking at UTM Apple Store Google Play How do I know if the app is right for me? How does the AMP app work for mobile? How does the AMP app work on desktop? What if I run in to issues using the AMP app? How do I know which purchase option is best for me? Pay Machine AMP App (mobile / desktop) How does the AMP app work for mobile? Step 1: Install the AMP Park App on your phone Apple Store Google Play Step 2: Using the "Menu" screen (three parallel lines), you may Login/Create an account with a unique password* *Creating an account is not required Step 3: Find your location on the map and click the appropriate map marker: Blue Map Marker Daytime parking Black Map Marker Evening / Weekend parking Review rate information and additional details. A non-refundable $0.25 transaction fee is applicable to each purchase. Step 4: Choose the amount of time you wish to park for Step 5: Enter your vehicle information Please ensure your license plate is entered correctly, otherwise your paid parking session will not be registered to your vehicle and you may end up getting ticketed Step 6: Select 'Continue' to go to checkout and fill out your credit card information. You may choose to save your credit card for extensions and future purchases. Step 7: Select 'Purchase' to finalize your parking payment Step 8: The current remaining time and option to extend your parking time are displayed in the app Step 9: You will receive an email receipt every time you purchase or extend your parking How does the AMP app work on desktop? Step 1: Open your preferred web browser and navigate to aimsmobilepay.com Step 2: Sign up and input your contact information if it is your first time, or login if you already have an account* * Creating an account is not required Step 3: Find your location on the map and click the appropriate map marker: Daytime parking Evening / Weekend parking Review rate information and additional details. A non-refundable $0.25 transaction fee is applicable to each purchase. Step 4: Choose the amount of time you wish to park for Step 5: Enter your vehicle information Please ensure your license plate is entered correctly, otherwise your paid parking session will not be registered to your vehicle and you may end up getting ticketed. Step 6: Select continue to go to the overview screen. Here you will add your credit card and billing information. Select purchase to finish the transaction. Step 7: Your remaining time will display with the option to extend time as long as you are still logged into the webpage. What if I run in to issues using the AMP app? If you are experiencing issues or errors with AMP, please try the following:

Barrier Free Parking UTM Parking & Transportation Services is committed to providing barrier free parking spaces to UTM community members and visitors with accessible needs. UTM has a number of parking spaces dedicated to the use of those who have a Provincial Ministry of Transportation Accessible Parking Permit (APP) . These spaces are for the sole use of UTM community members who have an APP parking permit, used in conjunction with UTM paid parking. For additional information, please refer to the Parking Regulations which can be found here . Please refer to the list below regarding the locations of dedicated barrier free accessible parking spaces on campus. You may also refer to this map indicating the location of barrier free accessible parking spaces on campus . If you have additional questions, please contact the Parking Office at parking.utm@utoronto.ca for more information. Barrier Free Parking Spaces on Campus Access to MaGrath Valley Residence (Updated: June 17/25 - Currently Unavailable) Access to Alumni House Visitor barrier free parking: Daily visitor parking permits may be purchased in P4, P8, & P9, or CCT at the Pay & Display machines by way of coin, Visa, MasterCard, American Express, or debit (via tap payment) or by way of the AMP Parking App . Please purchase your daily visitor permit before proceeding to park your vehicle. Parking permits are required on all vehicles parked on UTM property throughout the year. Visitors with a Government issued (MTO) accessible parking permit must also display a valid pay and display when parking on campus. Temporary Accessible Accommodation Individuals with temporary accessible needs (for example, a broken leg) may obtain, from Parking Services, a Temporary Permit for lots where accessible spaces are located allowing the vehicle bearing the permit to park in a general space in an alternate parking lot location. Please note that this temporary permit does not authorize use of the designated accessible parking spaces . If you are a student, please contact and register your accomodation request with UTM Access Ability Resource Centre . If you are a Faculty or Staff member, please contact and register your accomodation request with the Health and Well Being Office . parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Car Care Center In a rush, unexpected spill, or expecting bad weather on your way home? Not to worry, we're here to help! WHAT IS IT? WASHER FLUID $1.85 / L Pay as you go! Only pay for what you use. AIR PUMP $2.50 for 5 minutes CAR VACUUM $3 for 5 minutes WHERE IS IT? When looking at the RAWC it is in the top left corner of Lower P8. Once you're finished with the services please move your car to a paid parking spot. Any unattended car in the UTM Car Care Centre may be ticketed and / or towed. Sustainability is important to us, the UTM Car Care Centre helps to eliminate more unnecessary washer fluid plastic bottles heading to the landfill. And speaking of sustainability... did you know that we get increased fuel economy with properly inflated tires? It is a convenient solution for those pressed for time, caught off-guard, or who simply want to eliminate one more stop in their day. Bad weather? Not in the P8 underground - don't get wet when using the UTM Car Care Centre.

Office Hours 8:30am-11am 12:30pm-3:30pm Our office is closed on statutory holidays Email us Visit us We are located on campus 1550 The Collegeway Alumni House Suite 108 Meet the Team here : parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Department Vehicles Rules and Permits for UTM Department Vehicles Cost per lot P4 / P8 = $763.48 P5 = $1,099.95 P9 = $873.50 CCT = $1,364.15 Payment options To purchase a permit email the Parking & Transportation Services office. parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

License Plate Recognition (LPR) License Plate Recognition We use License Plate Recognition (LPR) on campus! LPR is an advanced parking technology that uses a vehicle's license plate as a permit instead of paper permits or hangtags. It is no longer be necessary to display cash receipts or permits in vehicles parked on the UTM campus. Multiple vehicles may be registered to your permit, however only one vehicle can be parked on campus at any given time. If a single permit is being shared by multiple users and more than 1 vehicle needs to be parked on campus at the same time, the additional vehicle(s) are required to register and purchase their own paid parking. A permit is valid for one (1) single vehicle to be parked on campus at any given time. Frequently Asked Questions How does it work? Paid parking and enforcement are in effect at all times on the UTM campus What if I drive multiple vehicles or share my permit with someone else? How do I update my license plate information or add a new vehicle? You can update your vehicle/license plate information at any time by logging into your account. Click here for more details . What information does the University of Toronto collect about your vehicle? The LPR system employed by the University of Toronto is a third-party system that captures a photo of the license plate of each vehicle parked in a University of Toronto Mississauga parking lot, streets on campus, or managed parking areas. An alphanumeric version of the license plate number is then generated and used to link the vehicle to paid parking in the University's Permit Management system. The LPR system also captures the location of the vehicle, as well as the time and date. The photos taken by the LPR system are not of a resolution that would allow for the identification of vehicle occupants if present at the time the photo is taken. Under what authority does the University of Toronto collect this information? All vehicles parked on the UTM campus are subject to the Parking Rules & Regulations authorized by the Principal of University of Toronto Mississauga, acting on the advice of the University of Toronto Mississauga Campus Council within the power granted by the University of Toronto Act 1971, through the Governing Council. By purchasing a parking permit, applicants agree to provide the information necessary for the proper administration of the University's parking facilities, including license plate information. For additional information on the University's governance structure, please visit: governingcouncil.utoronto.ca/governance-bodies/utm-campus-council For what purposes does the University of Toronto use your information? Your personal information will not be used for employee monitoring or any other purpose. Who do we share your information with? All personal information is collected, transferred, accessed, encrypted and protected by the University through technical and process protections. We share your information internally only as necessary for the purposes outlined above. Access to records created and maintained in connection with the LPR system is restricted to trained, authorized personnel performing their duties and, when necessary, a limited number of personnel with safety, security, or legal compliance roles and responsibilities. Personal information may be shared with third-party vendors (such as information technology and LPR solutions providers) for storage and other processing of personal information. Personal information will not be sold or licensed to any third parties for secondary commercial purposes. How long do we keep your information for? All information collected through the LPR and Permit Management systems is stored, retained, and disposed of in compliance with the University's Records Management practices. parking.utm@utoronto.ca Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Parking on Campus FAQs Frequently Asked Questions Is there anywhere on campus I can park for free? No, there is nowhere on campus that you can park for free. Parking must be paid for at all times. Is it true that I can park in any parking lot after 5:00 p.m. as long as I have a valid parking permit? Yes, all UTM parking permits are valid in all UTM parking lots after 5:00 p.m. from Monday to Friday and all day on Saturdays, Sundays and Statutory Holidays (with the exception of signed reserved spaces, car pool areas, resident parking - P6, P7 & P10 and the short term parking spaces on Inner Circle Road). I am a student who is only enrolled in evening classes. Is there a specific permit I can purchase that will allow me to park at night? Yes, you can purchase a monthly Evening parking permit. This permit is valid from 3:30 p.m. onward Monday-Thursday, and all day Friday/Saturday/Sunday & Holidays. It is valid in P4, P8 & P9. However, after 5:00 p.m. on weekdays and all day on weekends, permit holders may park in P1, P4, P5, P8, P9 and the CCT Garage as long as their permit is clearly displayed in the vehicle (with the exception of signed reserved spaces, car pool areas, resident parking - P6, P7 & P10 and the short term parking spaces on Inner Circle Road). If I have two or more cars, or need to make a change to my parking permit what can I do? You can register multiple vehicles (including rideshare/rental vehicles) to your parking permit, however only one (1) vehicle can be parked on campus at any given time. You can add/update license plates registered to your parking permit at any time by logging into your account here. If I have a valid UTM parking permit, can I also park at St. George or UTSC? If you have a valid UTM parking permit, you are only permitted to park in the designated lots at UTM. To inquire about parking for any other U of T campus, you must contact the Parking Office specific to that campus. I paid for parking at the Pay & Display machine but nothing printed. What should I do? Was I double-charged? If you attempted to pay for parking using a Pay machine and no slip printed, you were likely not charged. The machines operate by live authorizations and a ticket will only print if your transaction was approved. You are required to go through the steps again until the machine prints a slip. Failure to display a P&D slip for any reason (failed transaction, out of order machine, declined credit card, etc.) will result in a Parking Infraction Notice (parking ticket), issued by the City of Mississauga. Why can't I pay for parking at the Pay & Display machines in P1 and P5 on weekdays? On weekdays until 5:00 p.m., P1 & P5 are reserved for permit holders only. After 5:00 p.m. on weekdays and all day on weekends, patrons may purchase parking from the Pay & Display machines located in those lots. I only have to go into the William G. Davis Building for a few minutes. Is there somewhere close by I can park? Yes, you can pay for parking for up to 90 minutes (enforced maximum) in the short-term parking area located outside the William G. Davis Building. Do faculty and staff pay for parking? Yes, all faculty and staff pay for parking and they pay the same rates as students. How are parking fees set? Fees are set to cover the total costs of providing and maintaining parking facilities, smoothed over a reasonable number of years. This approach reduces the need to increase fees by large amounts in any given year (as had to be done several years ago when the underground CCT garage was built). Rather, fees are set to cover the costs over a reasonable timeframe, depending on the nature of the various costs involved. For example, the operation is currently paying back money borrowed to build the extension to the deck in lot P8 which was completed in 2016. How do I cancel my parking permit? Permits may be cancelled according to the cancellation schedule (Cancellations & Refunds) Cancellation requests must be received through the Parking Permit Portal. Many students are under severe financial pressure and cannot afford UTM parking rates. How is this issue of affordability/accessibility being addressed? Parking is one of many costs that a student may incur related to education. Anyone who is struggling financially should contact Financial Aid in the Office of the Registrar. Financial Aid is approached on a holistic basis, taking into account the financial situation of each particular student. Financial Aid Advisors will meet with a student and provide options after reviewing a student's entire financial situation, not just one aspect of it. Financial Aid offers walk-in advising, and can assist a student in reviewing their budget and identifying cost-effective strategies for managing their educational expenses. For example, in some cases Advisors may suggest alternative transportation methods which are readily available - such as taking advantage of the ‘U-pass' program, which allows UTM students unlimited fare-free rides on MiWay, Mississauga Transit's bus system. As well, the shuttle bus service that runs between the UTM and the St. George campus is free of charge for UTM students and is a cost-effective alternative for students who are taking courses at St. George and/or travel to downtown Toronto on a regular basis. Finally, sessional permits are available which allow students to purchase parking for individual sessions as compared to the 12 month annual pass, providing a more affordable option. License Plate Recognition We are excited to launch the use of License Plate Recognition (LPR) on campus. LPR is an advanced parking technology that uses a vehicle's license plate as a permit instead of paper permits or hangtags. Parking Payment Options on Campus The "AMP Park" app Now you have the choice to pay for parking using our easy-to-find and simple Pay & Display machines OR using the AMP Park app on your desktop or smartphone! Why do we love this app? Please note: You may not use the AMP app for parking past midnight, or overnight. Please use the Pay machines for parking past midnight and overnight parking. The AMP Park app A convenient way to pay for hourly or daily parking at UTM Apple Store Google Play How do I know if the app is right for me? How does the AMP app work for mobile? How does the AMP app work on desktop? What if I run in to issues using the AMP app? How do I know which purchase option is best for me? Pay Machine AMP App (mobile / desktop) How does the AMP app work for mobile? Step 1: Install the AMP Park App on your phone Apple Store Google Play Step 2: Using the "Menu" screen (three parallel lines), you may Login/Create an account with a unique password* *Creating an account is not required Step 3: Find your location on the map and click the appropriate map marker: Blue Map Marker Daytime parking Black Map Marker Evening / Weekend parking Review rate information and additional details. A non-refundable $0.25 transaction fee is applicable to each purchase. Step 4: Choose the amount of time you wish to park for Step 5: Enter your vehicle information Please ensure your license plate is entered correctly, otherwise your paid parking session will not be registered to your vehicle and you may end up getting ticketed Step 6: Select 'Continue' to go to checkout and fill out your credit card information. You may choose to save your credit card for extensions and future purchases. Step 7: Select 'Purchase' to finalize your parking payment Step 8: The current remaining time and option to extend your parking time are displayed in the app Step 9: You will receive an email receipt every time you purchase or extend your parking How does the AMP app work on desktop? Step 1: Open your preferred web browser and navigate to aimsmobilepay.com Step 2: Sign up and input your contact information if it is your first time, or login if you already have an account* * Creating an account is not required Step 3: Find your location on the map and click the appropriate map marker: Daytime parking Evening / Weekend parking Review rate information and additional details. A non-refundable $0.25 transaction fee is applicable to each purchase. Step 4: Choose the amount of time you wish to park for Step 5: Enter your vehicle information Please ensure your license plate is entered correctly, otherwise your paid parking session will not be registered to your vehicle and you may end up getting ticketed. Step 6: Select continue to go to the overview screen. Here you will add your credit card and billing information. Select purchase to finish the transaction. Step 7: Your remaining time will display with the option to extend time as long as you are still logged into the webpage. What if I run in to issues using the AMP app? Parking Permits If you're parking on campus, we have a number of permit options for you. Whether you're a student, staff, contractor, or something else entirely - we have solutions for you! Please select below who you are and you'll see your options. Should you still have unanswered questions, email us and we'll help you out! Purchase a Permit Register / Update a Vehicle What permit is best for you? I am a Commuting Student I am a Student in Residence I am Staff / Faculty I'm part of a Carpool I am Visiting Campus I am a Contractor I park Evenings & Weekends New Updates Frequently Asked Questions General Permit Information The purchase of a parking permit indicates your acceptance and agreement to obey all UTM Parking Regulations . Failure to do so will result in fines and possibly the loss of parking privileges. Permits are Virtual! Registering the license plate of your vehicle(s) will serve as a ‘virtual permit'. Permits are fully Virtual Annual Permits | STUDENTS Valid September 1, 2025 - August 31, 2026 HST Included - purchase totals may differ slightly due to tax calculation rounding Cancellation or Refunds Sessional Permits | STUDENTS Sessional parking permits are available to UTM students only and are valid in Lots P4 & P8 Permit Cost Monthly Breakdown $93.47 / month *New for 2025-26 * CCT Garage now has an 8 month sessional permit available HST - Included purchase totals may differ slightly due to tax calculation rounding Cancellation or Refunds Lottery Lot Assignment: Monday August 25, 2025 Purchase a Permit Back to top Parking Permits for UTM Students Living in Residence General Permit Information 2025-2026 Resident Parking Permits presale starts Thursday August 7th at 12:00 p.m. How do I apply? Permits are fully Virtual Annual Parking Permits | STAFF September 1, 2025 - August 31, 2026 Monthly Cost Annual Cost Purchase totals may differ slightly due to tax calculation rounding Temporary Permits | STAFF P1 Permits | STAFF Lottery details Waitlist details How to join the waitlist Other important information Please note: P1 is the only parking area available on the North side of campus, and as such permit holders may be asked to relocate to other lots on occasion (typically during the summer months) in order to accommodate special campus activities and events St. George Supplementary Permits | STAFF Purchase a Permit Back to top Parking Permits for Contractors General Permit Information Commercial Permit Valid in lots P4/P8 (unless otherwise arranged) * As of September 1st, 2025 Order a Commercial Permit General Hourly / Daily Parking Learn More about Hourly / Daily Parking Rates Back to top Parking Permits for Evenings & Weekends Available for all UTM community members Evening & Weekend Permit $22.01 / month * As of September 1, 2025 Purchase an Evening & Weekend Permit Back to top Parking Permits for Carpools Primary tabs To qualify for the Carpool Program, at least 2 UTM community members (students, faculty or staff), join together to form a carpool. They will bring one vehicle to campus at a time, therefore sharing the parking space and the cost of the parking permit. How does it work? How to Apply Carpool permits can be purchased during the regular staff and student presales for 2025-2026. Only 1 carpool member purchases the permit, then registers other members information with the parking office. Once you've purchased your carpool permit, Parking services will send an email with additional information, including the webform link. Purchase a Permit Back to top parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Once you've purchased your carpool permit, Parking services will send an email with additional information, including the webform link. Purchase a Permit Back to top parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Cancellations & Refunds All cancellation requests must be submitted on the Parking Permit Portal. Please review the new permit cancellation instructions below. New Permit Cancellation Instructions Please review the new permit cancellation instructions below. Step 1 : Visit the Parking Permit Portal Step 2 : Log in to your account using your UTORid if you are a UTM Staff/Student, or Email Authentication if otherwise. Step 3 : Select the " Permits " option on the left hand side to view your active permits. Select the "View" option next to the permit you wish to cancel (circled in red below). Step 4 : Select the "Request Cancellation " option located below the permit information (circled in red below). Step 5 : Please review the cancellation details carefully, then enter the date you would like your permit to be cancelled. Click " Confirm ." You will receive an email confirmation for your request, and may also view and print the details from your account at any time. Please Note: Your permit will remain active up to and including the cancellation date you have requested. If the date you have requested is after the 5th business day of the month, your permit will remain active until the last day of the month. Student annual and sessional permit cancellations are subject to a $25.00 administrative fee (included in rates below) Annual Student Permit Refund Schedule for the 2025/2026 Academic Year *The last day to cancel any student annual parking permit is March 06, 2026* Sessional Student Permit Refund Schedule for the 2025/2026 Academic Year *Student Sessional permits may be cancelled within the first (5) five business days of any month for which it is valid* parking.utm@utoronto.ca Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Register/Update a Vehicle Instructions : How to register and/or update a vehicle Step 1 : Log In Log in to your account on the online portal Step 2: Permits Select the 'Permits' tab Step 3 : View Find your current permit and select the 'View' tab Step 4 : Select Select "Add New Vehicle" or "Permanent Replacement" Step 5 : Confirm Once you've confirmed the new information a 'Processing Change' message may appear on your account. It may take up to 5 minutes to reflect the changes. Click here to login Add New Vehicle : Permanent Replacement : What if I drive multiple vehicles or share my permit with someone else? New: Permits are now virtual! It is no longer necessary to display parking permits in vehicles parked on the UTM campus. Instead, users register the license plates of the vehicles, which then links the vehicles to paid parking.

Resident Parking Permits for the 2024-2025 Academic Year How does UTM Resident parking work? Annual Resident Permits September 1 - August 31 Resident P5 Any Resident Resident P7 Schreiberwood residents ONLY (families with young children accommodated first) *Limited Availability (Assigned via Lottery) Resident P10 MacGrath Valley residents *Limited Availability (Assigned Via Lottery) Resident P5 permits are currently available. All other lots are waitlisted. New: Permits are now Virtual! Effective September 1, 2023, physical parking receipts and/or parking hangtags are no longer available at UTM parking lots. Instead, registering the license plate of your vehicle(s) online will serve as a ‘virtual permit'. parking.utm@utoronto.ca Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional We're going Virtual

Parking on the UTM Campus Whether you're coming to campus for the year or just a few hours, we've got the information you'll need to make parking on campus as easy as possible. All parking-related information is below. If you're looking for something else, head back to the Parking & Transportation homepage and you'll be able to best navigate to find the information you need, from there. Should you still have unanswered questions, email us and we'll help you out! What can we help you with? Parking Lot Info & Map Electric Vehicle Stations Parking Enforcement Motorcycle Parking Parking Safety Tips Rules & Regulations St. George Parking Services Frequently Asked Questions Can't find what you're looking for? Click here . PARKING HOT TIPS: Please Read FUN FACT: if you park on campus more than once a week, you will save money if you purchase a parking permit! Find more information on parking permits here . We thank the UTM community for observing good parking etiquette in our community. Consider the community if you must park elsewhere, and remember to park only in designated areas, at posted times, and for designated uses, or join the majority of our community and take advantage of transit, carpool, and active commuting to campus. Parking Lot Information & Map Download UTM Parking Lot Map Can't open the file? download and install Adobe Reader . Map includes: Are you visiting campus for the first time? Please visit UTM Visitors for additional information that may help you navigate parking on campus. Maximum height restrictions: If you are experiencing elevator difficulties in the CCT Garage please contact Facilities at ( 905) 828-5301 so a technician may be dispatched. Back to top EV Parking Spots & Charging Stations WHAT WE OFFER UTM Parking & Transportation Services is proud to support services for a greener future by providing electric vehicle (EV) charging stations on campus for your convenience. We have recently doubled the number of EV charging stations available for use on campus! WHERE ARE THE SPOTS 12 dedicated spaces are located in the lower level of parking deck P8 . HOW DOES IT WORK Users may charge for a maximum of 2.5 hours complimentary, and are then required to move their vehicle to another space in their assigned lot. A fee of $5 / hour applies to any vehicle left charging beyond the complimentary period. Connect to the charging stations via ChargePoint®, the world's largest EV charging network. Download the app: App Store or Google Play . Once Installed, go to Account ► Connections ► Browse Connections , and search for "UTM". Your connection request will automatically be approved after agreeing to the terms & conditions. It may take a few minutes for the ChargePoint® network to update before the stations will be visible. Lastly, please close and re-open the app. Please note that v ehicles may only park in the EV charging station spaces while actively charging! Paid parking is required at all times. UTM TERMS AND CONDITIONS Back to top Parking Enforcement Who enforces parking on campus? The City of Mississauga issues penalty notices (parking tickets) under the Administrative Penalty System (APS) for most parking violations on the UTM campus. Accessible parking tickets will continue to be managed through the Provincial Offenses Court. For more information about APS, please contact the City here. The tagging and towing of vehicles parked in violation of the current UTM Parking Regulations, will be performed by officers empowered to issue municipal parking tickets. More Information regarding parking enforcement on campus: UTM Parking Regulations Inquiries about the release of towed vehicles: Campus Safety What to do if you receive a parking infraction ticket UTM has no authority to revoke a City of Mississauga parking infraction ticket. Ticketing issues must proceed through the normal court system. Municipal parking tickets are payable to the City of Mississauga and fines are set by the City of Mississauga. Vehicles towed by the City of Mississauga will be released upon payment of towing and storage charges. These rates are set by the City and are liable to change without notice. City of Mississauga Parking Ticket Administration Back to top Motorcycle Parking New Motorcycle Permit Effective September 1, 2025, all Motorcycles parked on the UTM campus require valid, paid parking. A $20 monthly permit will be available for purchase online, valid for use in the designated motorcycle parking spaces in lots P9 and P5. PAID Parking Motorcycles parked in any other lot require valid, paid parking for that location. A motorcycle kickstand support plate must be used to prevent damage from the kickstand to the parking surface. Park LEGALLY Motorcycles, like any other vehicle, must be parked in parking spaces only. Motorcycles are Not permitted to park: Motorcycles parked improperly are subject to tagging and / or towing at the owner's expense. Purchase your Motorcycle permit here Back to top Safety Tips for Parking on Campus If you're ever in a situation where you feel unsafe, call the University of Toronto Mississauga Campus Safety emergency line (905) 569-4333 The time when many people feel most vulnerable is when they are either leaving or returning to a parked car - particularly at night. If you ever feel unsafe , please call Campus Safety . Keep your property safe Never leave credit cards in the car Examples of items: electronic devices such as GPS units, lap-top computers, personal listening devices, personal bags such as purses & gym bags, or any money including change Stay aware of your surroundings Getting to and from your car Tips for choosing a good spot Change it up Know who to call, and when Emergency (905) 569-4333/911 General (905) 828-5200 Back to top parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Waitlist Information How do the waitlists work? Once the maximum number of permits that can be reasonably accommodated in each area have been sold, waitlists are started for all other interested parties. As permits are cancelled, and Parking & Transportation Services monitors lot utilization to determine if more permits can be sold, additional permits will be released to those on waitlists in the order that they joined. How do I join a waitlist? How long will I be on the waitlist? How will I know if I am offered a permit? When is my next opportunity to purchase a parking permit? parking.utm@utoronto.ca Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Transportation to and from UTM No matter where you're coming from, we can help! If you're looking for public transit from your hometown, alternative methods of transportation, drop off rules 'n regs, or something more green - we've got helpful resources for you. If you can't find what you're looking for, or still have some questions, please email us and we'll help you out! * Alerts * Notice of Municipal Roadwork New MiWay Route! E-Scooters and E-Bikes What can we help you with? Brampton Transit "UTM Express" Regional Public Transit Lines UTM Shuttle Bus UTM Bike Share Zipcar | Car Sharing on Campus U-Pass | UTM Student Union Kiss'n Ride | Drop Off & Pick Up Transportation Alerts & Notices Notice of Municipal Roadwork On behalf of the City of Mississauga: Please note that there will be road work near campus that may impact your commute to campus due to lane reductions. WHAT: Bridge Rehabilitation Construction at Burnhamthorpe Road West, east of Mississauga Road over the Credit River WHEN: August 1, 2024 to December 31 2024 TIME: Monday to Friday, 7AM-7PM Weekend work will take place on an as-needed basis For General Inquiries , please call 3-1-1, (905-615-4311 outside City limits) to speak to Customer Service. On behalf of the City of Mississauga: Please note that there will be road work near campus that may impact your commute to campus due to lane reductions. WHAT: Retaining Wall Project at Two Locations: Erindale Park Entrance to Credit River & Robinson Street To Dundas Crescent WHEN: O n or before June 17, 2024 and end on or before July 31, 2025 For General Inquiries , please call 3-1-1, (905-615-4311 outside City limits) to speak to Customer Service or public.info@mississauga.ca New Route 126 Burnhamthorpe Express The new Route 126 Burnhamthorpe Express will service key stops between the University of Toronto Mississauga and the Kipling Bus Terminal in Toronto, on Burnhamthorpe Road in Mississauga and Dundas Street in Toronto. Visit the MiWay Service Announcement Page for more details on this and other service improvements. E-Scooters and E-Bikes The City of Mississauga has partnered with Lime Technology, Inc. and Bird Canada to introduce e-scooters and e-bikes across Mississauga. This initiative aims to test the viability of e-scooters and e-bikes as an eco-friendly transportation option around Mississauga. Visit the Sustainability Office's webpage for more information. Back to top Brampton Transit: Express UTM Bus Route UTM and Brampton Transit offer an express bus transit route between the Brampton Gateway Terminal and UTM. This service is operated by Brampton Transit and is part of its normal fare structure, allowing riders the choice to pay with cash or their PRESTO cards. Please Note: this program is not associated with UTM's U-Pass or MiWay Route Details This express service will run directly between the Brampton Gateway Terminal (intersection of Steeles Ave. and Main St., adjoining Shoppers World shopping centre) and UTM (near the UTM Student Centre) without stops in-between Dates of operation and schedule For an up-to-date schedule and route map, please select route 199 UTM Express on the Brampton Transit schedules website Payment Methods & Price Individual riders will pay the normal Brampton Transit fare when boarding; the cost varies depending on whether the passenger pays a single cash fare or uses a PRESTO card See the Brampton Transit website for fares and other information Making the Route work with Your Schedule One express bus is scheduled for each departure If there are more interested riders than the capacity of the express bus, those who cannot be accommodated on the express bus can use alternative routes that typically transfer between Brampton Transit and MiWay at the Mississauga City Centre Transit Terminal at Square One - this results in a longer travel time but offers more flexible schedule options Back to top Kiss 'n Ride There are three designated pick up & drop off locations (laybys) located on campus! Hazel McCallion Academic Learning Centre (UTM Library) William G. Davis Building (Inner Circle Road) Deerfield Hall (Outer Circle Road) Back to top Regional Public Transportation Need help finding public transportation options to campus? Check out some of the below! Toronto Transit Click here York Region Transit Click here Oakville Transit Click here Brampton Transit Click here GO Transit Click here Back to top Zipcar | On-demand access to drive cars by the hour or the day Zipcar is a car sharing service available on campus and is open to all staff, faculty and students. Car sharing is a sustainable transportation option with many benefits! Faculty, Staff and Students can register with Zipcar and become a member. Please note: Zipcars are located in designated parking spaces in Lot P9 for user convenience Already a member? Why Zipcar? Become a Member! Back to top parking.utm@utoronto.ca 905-828-5254 Alumni House, Room 108 Making experiences, exceptional

Transportation & Parking Advisory Committee (TPAC) Transportation and Parking Advisory Committee Terms of Reference The University of Toronto Mississauga Transportation and Parking Advisory Committee is responsible for considering specific transportation, transit, and parking issues and tasked with providing feedback to senior administration. The committee also receives the annual parking ancillary budget and management report for review and feedback. Responsibilities The committee functions in a consultative and advisory capacity to the Chief Administrative Officer (CAO). It provides feedback and recommendations on the following items, which will then be reported through the CAO, an administrative assessor to the Campus Affairs Committee, as appropriate: Terms of Office The term of office for student members shall normally be one year, during the fall and winter semesters of the academic year. The Chair shall be appointed by the CAO for up to a three-year term. Where a transition of Chairs is anticipated, a Vice Chair may be appointed for one year to observe the activities of the committee. Meetings of this committee will be called by the Chief Administrative Officer as business arises that needs consideration regarding specific matters and projects related to transportation and parking. The meetings will have no formal minutes, but a record will be kept of any action or follow-up needed. The committee, through the administrative assessor to the Campus Affairs Committee, will periodically report its activities and issues related to transportation and parking.

Visitor Parking Whether you're on campus for a few hours or coming consistently, we've got a solution for you! All visitors have the option to pay the hourly or daily rates. However, if you are parking consistently, we may have a more specific parking permit option for you. Find your circumstance below to find the best parking solution for you. Should you still have unanswered questions, email us and we'll help you out! I'm a contractor I'm only here evenings & weekends Hourly & Daily Parking Rates | Pay-by-Plate How to Pay for Parking *Weekday parking before 5pm in these lots is strictly prohibited Payment Method Do I need to pay? Helpful Links Map & Directions Accessible Parking for Visitors The "AMP Park" mobile payment app Daily Parking Rates Evening, Weekend, & Holiday Parking Rates The daily Pay-by-Plate rates may be adjusted from time to time, according to market conditions (all prices include HST) Accessible Parking for Visitors Parking Services at U of T Mississauga has a number of parking spaces dedicated to the use of those who have a Provincial Ministry of Transportation Accessible Parking Permit (APP) . These spaces are for the sole use of UTM community members who have an APP parking permit, used in conjunction with either a UTM parking permit or UTM daily/visitor permit. Please learn more about the barrier free (accessible) parking spaces on campus here Back to top
